newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Ciba sees U.S. Novartis decision in autumn.
newsitem.headline: Ciba sees U.S. Novartis decision in autumn.

text.p: Ciba-Geigy AG said it expected the U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) to rule in late autumn on its proposed merger with Sandoz AG to form Novartis AG.
"The FTC is expected to announce its decision in late autumn," the company said in a statement.
Novartis' designated chief executive, Daniel Vasella, has said in the past that the merger might be pushed back into 1997 because of slower than expected U.S. regulatory review.

"The preparations for merging with Sandoz are already at an advanced stage. The merger can be implemented once the FTC has given its clearance," it said, adding it had recently announced the sales of parts of its corn herbicide and animal health activities in North America.
"These diverstitures respond to the FTC's concerns in these areas. Investigations in the field of gene therapy are not yet complete," it said it is statement on nine-month sales.
Sandoz included a similar comment in its separate statement on nine-month sales.
